question: I understand on judgment day people will walk a wire across the Kidron Valley. Could you explain this? Thank you.
answer:
QUESTION
I lived in Saudi Arabia for four years and heard of walking a tightrope or wire across the Kidron or Himnon Valley to the Dome of the Rock. Those who were not worthy would fall into flames below, while the righteous would attain the other side and enter into paradise. I have not been able to find a reference to it in the Qur'an and I can't find any further information. I would like to know if this is correct and where it comes from. Thank you for your time.
ANSWER


Share:
We have not come across a Hadith referring to the crossing of the Kidron
valley.

However, there is a Hadith referring to crossing the bridge over hell
(Jahannum) which is thinner than a blade. The bridge will have huge grippers
on the side. If a person is unsuccessful in crossing the bridge, he will be
caught by the grippers and thrown into hell. This Hadith is narrated in
Bukhari vol.2

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
FATWA DEPT.
